description: From Middle English mistasten, equivalent to mis- +â€Ž taste.

entries.meaning: A wrong, bad, or illicit taste

verbs.description: mistaste (third-person singular simple present mistastes, present participle mistasting, simple past and past participle mistasted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To overindulge in food or drink
(transitive, obsolete) To take wrongly or in error; mistake; err
(transitive, archaic) To taste wrongly or in error
examples: The support provided by custom or by the oenological guide serves only to make it understood that one has not tasted the wine or, having mistasted it, that one perceived nothing or almost nothing.
